comment: Make sure you do the volunteer work at the beginning of the semester. You have to read the book, study powerpoints, study slides, and study notes in order to pass each test. Tests are not cumulative. She cares about students. Will try to help you out if the problem isn't related to the class. Great guest speakers. Very strict about syllabus rules.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Fun and informative class with lots of guest speakers. Tests are tough so you have to study but she does give extra credit points and is very easy on papers. Do the volunteer hours early in the semester. Read the assigned book as listed on syllabus to be able to keep up with discussions in class. I would take again.

Amazing Professor! Really inspires and gives you advice on how to better yourself for your future no matter what career you are going into. Would love to have her again. Tests are not tough, as long as you do the readings. Guest Speakers are always fun to! Attendance is taken so go to class, you don't want to miss clues or hints for the tests!

She's not a tough teacher, she just has very definite expectations and if you don't meet them she has zero sympathy/ empathy. I came to her for help halfway through the semester and she actually told me I needed to be on medication and she offered to be a surrogate mother to me after talking for about 5 minutes. Easy class, weird lady.

Have to have 20 volunteer hours over the course of the semester, but that's not really too hard over four months or so.   Looks like the sweetest old lady, but don't walk in front of her when she's lecturing or when a guest speaker is present, or she will chew you out. Study the clear study guides she provides, and you will pass the tests.

She is a fine teacher. Attendance is mandatory, but she has a lot of speakers come in that work in the Human Services field so its fun to go to class. She literally reads from her power points (they're online too). There are a lot of tests, midterm, and final. Her tests are pretty easy but if you misspell anything its automatically wrong.

Absolutely love this teacher. Study the powerpoints and study guides and you will make an A! I almost forgot to say that make sure you attend all her classes and also do the extra credit.. She is very sweet, but very sassy!

Study guides are useless. She doesn't necessarily teach, but rather reads from the powerpoint. You must go to class or you will lose points. If you aren't interested in human services take another class.

Very good teacher (a little hard of hearing though).  Very knowledgeable.  Just study her powerpoints and study guides and you will do well.  Most of all get the extra credit, you may need it in the end to boost your grade to the next level.
must fill in blank. part study guide and part book. Not easy. Not a good instructor, makes it harder than it should be.

Super easy class. If you study the guides she provides there is no way you can do poorly. Sometimes contents a little boring but she makes up for from all of her life experiences. She is willing to help you out as long as you put in a little effort yourself. She also has a lot of connections in the field.

If you don't show up, your grade will be bad. You have to do 20 hours of volunteering, and on the first quiz she asks the author of the book. She doesn't really teach anything except a handful of times, you are expected to teach yourself. I did pretty well just looking over the study guides.

I did not care for this professor, specifically her testing style. Nothing is multiple choice and her study guides are useless. Attendance can really hurt your grade and there are 20 hours of required community service. This class was a waste of time.

Shes nice... thinks shes more funny than she really is, old people humor. Quizzes are dumb. You literally have to fill in the blank, definitions.. no scantron. Class is simple and easy... but you need TIME if you take her!
She is my favorite professor I've had. She makes class interesting and current. If I could, I would take her again and again.
TAKE HER! She is the best professor I've had at KSU so far.

Great Lady! I would take her for every class if I could. No need for the book. Everything on test comes from study sheets and powerpoints. 20 hours of volunteer work, 2 papers, 4 quizzes, a midterm, a final, and attendance make up your grade. If you show up you will do fine. She is amazing. TAKE HER!

She expects you to learn in this class but, tries to give her students a chance to succeed. I think this lady has been through a lot of struggles in life and is a good person - I think she is totally misunderstood.I got an A. Take her!

Professor Maxwell has experience in the juvenil court.  She shares a lot of that in class which I like because you cannot read that in books.  She will give you a tudy guide, you must study because its not all multiple choice.  You have to fill in the gaps.  Learn the author name of your book , she will ask on quiz.   Older, but Great teacher.

The worse professor I have ever had. She is not empathetic and should not be teaching Overview of HS. Her course work is not impossible. I just Think her people skills are not the example of what Human Service is based upon. She needs to retire.

She is so misunderstood.. Honestly I like her she is understanding and easy going. My first time taking her I was a little confused about her personality, but after taking her for another course..I completely understand. She is a older proff and has been through a lot and she takes her profession very seriously. Coming to class is a must! Take her!

I really enjoy Professor Maxwell's class. If you just study for her quizzes and tests you will do fine! She is pretty lenient when it comes to grading. She sometimes does extra cedit which is helpful. I have taken her for two Human Services class's and I would take her again.
Needs to retire ASAP! Rude and disrespectable toward the student body. Give wrong information and is not clear when explaining details from the book. Avoid this professor if you can!

Completely different experience. Class is extremely boring; she lectures straight from notes posted online. Everything taught is apart of teacher package; absolutely no original material or effort put into class;Class exercises complete waste of time;had nothing to do with course content. Talks down to students and is extremely disrespectful. AVOID
Pretty easy quizzes. 1 book review paper and abstract/presentation. Midterm, Final and attendance. She's a little out there but overall nice and not boring

Class was interesting, no boring note taking, discuss real life issues, study guide for every quiz, 5 article summaries-easy, volunteer proj-easy. Show up, do study guide, turn in papers = make an A. A little of the cuff, but I like her.

Class was interesting, discussions on real life issues. She has study guides for every chapter, quizes come straight off the study guide, no pop quizes. 5 article summaries, 1 paper, volunteer proj, & final.  As long as you study for quizes and do the work, you should get an A.  She is a little off the cuff, but interesting. I like this prof.
she gives pop quiz / test without warning.  She tells too many stories that have nothing to do with the class
No Comments
